page.title: 09WELLHOUSE MORAVIAN CHURCH
page.content: I am a{Moravian,}one of 4000 in Britain, in 1 of 42 congregations. There are just over 500,000 in the world. The church that I go to stands in Wellhouse opposite my school. It was built in 1970 after the older one, {built in 1755,}was pulled down. A small settlement of houses, which are still standing, was built next to the church for the congregation. The Moravians set out from Moravia in {Bohemia,}that is how we got our name. We were the first{heretics}to officially leave the Church of Rome. Our hymn book is one of the oldest in the world. It was published in 1503. There have been many{ministers}of our church and at the moment it is Rev. R.J.Hopcroft who has been minister now for 7 years. Normal services have approximately 50 people in attendance each Sunday.
